member.name: T:RogueElements.ClampFloorStep`1
member.summary: Clamps the floor plan to at least a minimum size, at most a maximum size. If the bounds of the current roomplan maximum, the size will increase to include them.

member.name: T:RogueElements.ConnectBranchStep`1
member.summary: Takes the current floor plan and connects the ends of its branches to other rooms. A room is considered the end of a branch when it is connected to only one other room. ie, a dead end.

member.name: P:RogueElements.ConnectBranchStep`1.ConnectPercent
member.summary: The percentage of eligible branches to connect.

member.name: T:RogueElements.ConnectStep`1
member.summary: Finds rooms in the floor plan that can be connected and connects them.

member.name: P:RogueElements.ConnectStep`1.Filters
member.summary: Determines which rooms are eligible to be connected.

member.name: P:RogueElements.ConnectStep`1.GenericHalls
member.summary: The room types that can be used as the hall connecting the two base rooms.

member.name: P:RogueElements.ConnectStep`1.Components
member.summary: Components that the newly added halls will be labeled with.

member.name: T:RogueElements.DrawFloorToTileStep`1
member.summary: Takes the floor plan of the map and draws all tiles in all rooms to the actual map. This is typically done once per floor generation. It must only be done after the floor plan itself is complete.

member.name: P:RogueElements.DrawFloorToTileStep`1.Padding
member.summary: Adds the specified number of tiles to the border of the map as wall terrain.

member.summary: Changes size without changing the start.

member.name: T:RogueElements.FloorRoomPlan
member.summary: Contains data about which cells a room occupies in a FloorPlan.

member.name: T:RogueElements.FloorStairsStep`3
member.summary: Adds the entrance and exit to the floor. Is room-conscious. The algorithm will try to place them far away from each other in different rooms.

member.name: P:RogueElements.FloorStairsStep`3.Entrances
member.summary: List of entrance objects to spawn.

member.name: P:RogueElements.FloorStairsStep`3.Exits
member.summary: List of exit objects to spawn.

member.name: P:RogueElements.FloorStairsStep`3.Filters
member.summary: Used to filter out rooms that do not make suitable entrances/exits, such as boss rooms.

member.summary: Attempt to choose a room with no entrance/exit, and updates their availability. If none exists, default to a chosen room.

todo: describe used_indices parameter on NextRoom

member.summary: Takes the current floor plan and adds new rooms that are disconnected from existing rooms.

member.summary: The number of rooms to add.

member.summary: The room types that can be used for the room being added.

member.name: T:RogueElements.ConnectRoomStep`1
member.summary: Takes the current floor plan and connects its rooms with other rooms.

member.name: P:RogueElements.ConnectRoomStep`1.ConnectFactor
member.summary: Determines the number of connections to make. 0 = No Connections 50 = Half of all rooms connected 100 = All rooms connected 200 = All rooms connected twice over

member.name: T:RogueElements.InitFloorPlanStep`1
member.summary: Initializes an empty floor plan, which is a list of rooms that keep track of their size, position, and connectivity with each other. Gen Steps that operate on the floor plan can add rooms, delete them, or change the rooms in some way. Once finished, apply DrawFloorToTileStep to draw the actual tiles of the rooms.

member.name: P:RogueElements.FloorPathStartStepGeneric`1.GenericRooms
member.summary: The room types that can be used for the rooms of the layout.

member.name: P:RogueElements.FloorPathStartStepGeneric`1.RoomComponents
member.summary: Components that the newly added rooms will be labeled with.

member.name: P:RogueElements.FloorPathStartStepGeneric`1.GenericHalls
member.summary: The room types that can be used for the halls of the layout.

member.name: P:RogueElements.FloorPathStartStepGeneric`1.HallComponents
member.summary: Components that the newly added halls will be labeled with.

member.name: T:RogueElements.FloorPathBranch`1
member.summary: Populates the empty floor plan of a map by creating a minimum spanning tree of connected rooms and halls.

member.name: P:RogueElements.FloorPathBranch`1.FillPercent
member.summary: The percentage of total space in the floor plan that the step aims to fill with rooms.

member.name: P:RogueElements.FloorPathBranch`1.HallPercent
member.summary: The chance that rooms are attached ot each other using an intermediate hallway.

member.name: P:RogueElements.FloorPathBranch`1.BranchRatio
member.summary: The percent amount of branching paths the layout will have in relation to its straight paths. 0 = A layout without branches. (Worm) 50 = A layout that branches once for every two extensions. (Tree) 100 = A layout that branches once for every extension. (Branchier Tree) 200 = A layout that branches twice for every extension. (Fuzzy Worm)

member.name: P:RogueElements.FloorPathBranch`1.NoForcedBranches
member.summary: Prevents the step from making branches in the path, even if it would fail the space-fill quota.

member.name: M:RogueElements.FloorPathBranch`1.GetPossibleExpansions(RogueElements.FloorPlan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets all possible places a new path node can be added.
member.param: Chooses to branch from a path instead of extending it.
member.returns: All possible RoomHallIndex that can receive an expansion.

member.name: T:RogueElements.SetSpecialRoomStep`1
member.summary: Takes an existing floor plan and changes one of the rooms into the specified room type. The size of the room may change because of this, and thus may also require the addition of a supporting hallway.

member.summary: The room to place. It can be chosen out of several possibilities, but only one room will be placed.

member.summary: Determines which rooms are eligible to be turned into the new room type.

member.summary: Components that the newly added room will be labeled with.

member.name: P:RogueElements.SetSpecialRoomStep`1.Halls
member.summary: When changing a room to a new type, the new type may be smaller and require a supporting hallway. This variable determines the room types that can be used as the intermediate hall.

member.name: P:RogueElements.SetSpecialRoomStep`1.HallComponents
member.summary: Components that the newly added halls will be labeled with.

member.summary: Takes the current grid plan and connects the ends of its branches to other rooms. A room is considered the end of a branch when it is connected to only one other room. ie, a dead end.

member.summary: The percentage of eligible branches to connect.

member.name: P:RogueElements.ConnectGridBranchStep`1.Filters

member.name: P:RogueElements.ConnectGridBranchStep`1.HallComponents
member.summary: Components that the newly added halls will be labeled with.

member.name: T:RogueElements.GridRoomPlan
member.summary: Contains data about which cells a room occupies in a GridFloorPlan.

member.name: T:RogueElements.InitGridPlanStep`1
member.summary: Initializes an empty grid plan, which is a grid of rooms and connecting hallways. Unlike a floor plan, the rooms in a grid plan are rigidly defined to be cells in a grid, instead of being placed in freestyle. Gen Steps that operate on the grid plan can add, erase, or change rooms/hallways. Once finished, apply DrawGridToFloorStep to take the grid and create a floor plan.

member.name: P:RogueElements.InitGridPlanStep`1.CellWidth
member.summary: The width of all cells in the grid.

member.name: P:RogueElements.InitGridPlanStep`1.CellHeight
member.summary: The height of all cells in the grid.

member.name: P:RogueElements.InitGridPlanStep`1.CellX
member.summary: The number of columns in the grid.

member.name: P:RogueElements.InitGridPlanStep`1.CellY
member.summary: The number of rows in the grid.

member.name: P:RogueElements.InitGridPlanStep`1.CellWall
member.summary: The thickness of the dividers between cells in the grid, in tiles.

member.name: T:RogueElements.PermissiveRoomGen`1
member.summary: Subclass of RoomGen that can fulfill any combination of paths leading into it.

member.name: T:RogueElements.RoomGen`1
member.summary: A class representing a room-generating algorithm. It supports connections to other rooms.
member.remarks: RoomGens obey the following rules: 1. All RoomGens must generate a solvable room. Aka, one where it is possible to get to any opening in its 4 sides, to any other opening in its 4 sides. * This means, it is okay if some generated rooms can be “cheesed” out of any self-contained puzzle they’re trying to make.A cheesable room is better than a wholly unsolvable. 2. All RoomGens must be capable of taking any Size, and generate without throwing an exception. * So if you have a RoomGen that is meant to make a complicated self contained maze, and the calling code says "No, you only get 2x2 tiles of space to work with, deal with it", it will have to comply. (Usually by just making a blank square) * But, you can ask a RoomGen what dimensions it would like to be, and then pass it those dimensions to play nice with it.This is the usual case. 3. A RoomGen must be able to produce at least one opening for each of the four cardinal directions, if asked. * For example, a simple square room has openings on all four sides regardless of how it’s generated.Certain styles of rooms do not want to have any walkable tiles on the North border unless mandated. * Another example would be if the algorithm from above placed this RoomGen between two rooms: one above and one below.It wants to connect them from above and below.The RoomGen must provide an opening somewhere for its north and south borders. * The keyword is somewhere.Somewhere that the RoomGen gets to pick and the calling code cannot.
member.typeparam: The MapGenContext to apply the room to.

member.name: P:RogueElements.RoomGen`1.Draw
member.summary: The rectangle that the room is drawn in.

member.name: M:RogueElements.RoomGen`1.Copy
member.summary: Creates a copy of the object, to be placed in the generated layout.

member.name: T:RogueElements.DefaultTerrainStencil`1
member.summary: A filter for determining the eligible tiles for an operation. All tiles are eligible.

member.name: T:RogueElements.MapTerrainStencil`1
member.summary: A filter for determining the eligible tiles for an operation. Tiles of a certain type are eligible.

member.name: P:RogueElements.MapTerrainStencil`1.Room
member.summary: Allows tiles specified as the map's walkable terrain.

member.name: P:RogueElements.MapTerrainStencil`1.Wall
member.summary: Allows tiles specified as the map's wall terrain.

member.name: P:RogueElements.MapTerrainStencil`1.Not
member.summary: Reverses the policy, allowing all tiles EXCEPT the ones selected above.

member.name: T:RogueElements.MatchTerrainStencil`1
member.summary: A filter for determining the eligible tiles for an operation. Tiles in a list of allowed tile types are eligible.

member.name: P:RogueElements.MatchTerrainStencil`1.MatchTiles
member.summary: The allowed tile types.

member.name: T:RogueElements.PerlinWaterStep`1
member.summary: Generates a random spread of water on the map. This is achieved by generating a heightContext using Perlin Noise, then converting all tiles with a height value below the specified threshold to water.

member.name: P:RogueElements.PerlinWaterStep`1.OrderComplexity
member.summary: Determines how many iterations of Perlin noise to generate the heighTContext with. Higher complexity = higher variation of heights and more natural looking terrain.

member.name: P:RogueElements.PerlinWaterStep`1.OrderSoftness
member.summary: Determines the smallest unit of water tiles on the map. 0 = 1x1 tile of water, 1 = 2x2 tile of water, etc.

member.name: P:RogueElements.PerlinWaterStep`1.WaterPercent
member.summary: The percent chance of water occurring.

member.name: P:RogueElements.WaterStep`1.Terrain
member.summary: Tile representing the water terrain to paint with.

member.name: P:RogueElements.WaterStep`1.TerrainStencil
member.summary: Determines which tiles are eligible to be painted on.

member.name: M:RogueElements.Rect.ToString
member.summary: Returns a representation of this in the format: {X:[] Y:[] Width:[] Height:[]}

member.name: M:RogueElements.Rect.IntersectionDepth(RogueElements.Rect)
member.summary: Calculates the signed depth of intersection between two rectangles.
member.param: todo: describe other parameter on IntersectionDepth
member.returns: The amount of overlap between two intersecting rectangles. These depth values can be negative depending on which wides the rectangles intersect. This allows callers to determine the correct direction to push objects in order to resolve collisions. If the rectangles are not intersecting, Loc.Zero is returned.
